senobia Lakes EST subdivision was

on more than one occasion the

chairman uh several years ago the
lowincome water assistance program was
put together on a temporary basis and we
just want to appreciate everybody who

together um across all the state
government to kind of help us move this
forward nationally I'd ask for a policy
analyist Miss McClure to come read the
resolution1 calling for permanent annual
federal funding for a low income
household water assistance program
whereas the Consolidated Appropriations
Act of 2021 one which became law on
December 27th 2020 provided 638 million
to the US Department of Health and Human
Services HHS office of community
services OCS and administrations for
Children and Families ACS for Grants to
carry out a lowincome household water
assistance program lwop in response to
the Corona virus pandemic whereas on
March 11th 2021 the American Rescue plan
act appropriated an additional 500
million in emergency spending for lwop
bringing the total funding for the
program to 1.38 billion whereas lwop is
an emergency program to assist
low-income households with their water
and wastewater bills the priority for
lwop is to ensure that households whose
Services have been disconnected due to
non-payment are or are about to be
disconnected are able to have their
services restored as quickly as possible
whereas these grants issued through lwop
provide funds to owners or operators of
public service system Sy or treatment
works to reduce aages and rates of
lowincome households for the purpose of
lwop owners and operators of public
water systems are utilities that provide
water for human consumption through
pipes or other constructed conveyances
and include the water utilities
regulated by the state public service
utility commissions that com that com
that comprise the National Association
of regulatory utility Commissioners n
whereas parties eligible to apply for
lwop Grants are the state the District
of colia the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico
US territories Fally and state
recognized Indian tribes and tribal
organiz tribe I'm sorry and tribal
organizations that receive similar
utility assistance grants and fiscal
year
2021 whereas establishing a new federal
assistance program was a complex process
at the federal state territory tribal
and local level it required an extensive
amount of effort by OCS States and
utilities to get the program up and
running ensure customers were aware of
the program and to distribute funds to
these eligible to those eligible whereas
data from lwop third quarter report
indicates that during the first three
quarters of fiscal year 2022 starting
October 2nd 2021 through June 30th 2022
46 States and over 70 tribes have
submitted lwop applications over 304,000
households receive lwop assistance and
over 999,000 households had Services
restored or disconnection prevented
through liw benefits assistance whereas
was a temporary emergency program that
ran from January 4th 2022 until
September 30th 2023 whereas the US
economy continues to falter with
inflation and Rising interest rates
which means the need to help customers
pay for their water bills continues to
exist whereas lack of whereas lack of
running water makes a dwelling
uninhabitable whereas the liwat program
expired without establishing a Permanent
Fund and water customers who have relied
on liw to help pay their bills were s
will suffer without this assistance now
therefore be it resolved that the
Mississippi Public Service Commission
urges Congress to provide permanent
annual funding for a federal lowincome
household water assistance program thank

resolution whereas the Mississippi
Public Service Commission join the
United States Department of Agriculture
recognized October as National Co-op
month 2024 under the theme the future is
cooperative envisioning The Cooperative
future whereas corporations are the
vital pillar of our rural economics
and uh contribution to essential goods
and services to rural Mississippi
including local grown food housing
electricity Financial Services internet
retail services and so much more whereas
25 electrical distribution cooperatives
in one generation and transmission
Cooperative provide electrical services
throughout 85% of the State Mississippi
and 50% of the state's electrical meters
delivering affordable and reliable power
to our homes and businesses whereas more
than 30,000 cooperatives in the United
States provide more than 700 billion to
the economy with support amongst
governmental and Business Leaders
building strong
reliable communities
improving servicing bolstering local
economies allowing members to prosper
whereas through the many influential
uses and shared services by cooperatives
the sustainable and resilient
Cooperative model creates a stronger
future for our communities achieving
greater measures of strength and success
now therefore be it resolved that the
Mississippi Public Service Commissioners
do hereby proclaimed October as National
Co-op month in the state of Mississippi
encourage all citizens to recognize and
support through Cooperative businesses
within our community understand these
significant impact on local economies
and the benefits they provide to their
